paragraphs.body: Riehle was born in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin, the son of Mary Margaret (née Walsh), a nurse, and Herbert John Riehle (1921–61), an assistant postmaster. He attended the University of Notre Dame.
paragraphs.text: Riehle was born in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin, the son of Mary Margaret (née Walsh), a nurse, and Herbert John Riehle (1921–61), an assistant postmaster. He attended the University of Notre Dame.

paragraphs.body: At Notre Dame, Riehle became involved with the University Theatre, appearing in productions such as Luther, Romeo and Juliet, and How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying, and also taking on the role as stage manager during productions. After spending time at the Academy of Dramatic Art in Rochester, Michigan, he moved on to Broadway and debuted in 1986 in the production of Execution of Justice. In 1999, Riehle had a major film role as drunken, corrupt, ex-cop Pat McGloin in the acclaimed revival of The Iceman Cometh. He has also worked with the Adams-Jefferson Project of Carleton College, participating in the a series of recordings of the correspondence between the two United States presidents.
